function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Confinement conditions impact perception and willingness to pay for green areas.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Impact of covid-19 on perception of green spaces","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inconsistency in drivers for wtp for green roofs","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Comparing both models, the only two variables in common are the number of inhabitants under 12 and the relative contribution to the household income.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"It is interesting to notice how the wtp for a large green roof in portugal builds up on the wtp for a smaller one and the availability to pay more for a larger one.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Educational level, household inhabitants, and other socio-economic factors found to be statistically significant in the model for the wtp for a larger green roof in other countries.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Multinomial logistic regression model developed due to violation of proportional odds assumption in ordinal regression model.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Significant difference in accuracy of models for portugal and other countries in wtp analysis.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Variables statistically significant in the model for wtp for a medium size accessible
